page.title: The Other Side (SZA and Justin Timberlake song)

revision.text:
{{Infobox song | name = The Other Side | type = single | cover = SZA and Justin Timberlake - The Other Side.png | alt = | artist = [[SZA (singer)|SZA]] and [[Justin Timberlake]] | album = [[Trolls World Tour (soundtrack)|Trolls World Tour (Original Motion Picture Soundtrack)]] | released = {{start date|2020|02|26|mf=y}} | recorded = 2019 | studio = | genre = *[[Disco music|Disco]]{{cite web |title=Here Are the Lyrics to SZA & Justin Timberlake's 'The Other Side |url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/lyrics/9333138/sza-justin-timberlake-the-other-side-lyrics |website=Billboard |accessdate=March 31, 2020}} *[[Pop music|pop]] | length = 3:08 (single version)
2:55 (radio edit) | label = [[RCA Records|RCA]] | writer = {{hlist|[[SZA (singer)|Solána Rowe]]|[[Justin Timberlake]]|[[Ludwig Göransson]]|[[Max Martin]]|[[Sarah Aarons]]}} | producer = {{hlist|Justin Timberlake|Ludwig Göransson }} | chronology = [[SZA (singer)|SZA]] | prev_title = [[Just Us (song)|Just Us]] | prev_year = 2019 | next_title = | next_year = | misc = {{Extra chronology | artist = [[Justin Timberlake]] | type = single | prev_title = [[Believe (Meek Mill song)|Believe]] | prev_year = 2020 | title = The Other Side | year = 2020 | next_title = Don't Slack | next_year = 2020 }} {{external music video|type=single|{{YouTube|C5RrNaCfUXE|"The Other Side"}}}} }} "'''The Other Side'''" is a song by American singers [[SZA (singer)|SZA]] and [[Justin Timberlake]]. It was released on February 26, 2020, as the lead single from the ''[[Trolls World Tour]]'' companion soundtrack, ''[[Trolls World Tour (soundtrack)|Trolls World Tour (Original Motion Picture Soundtrack)]]''. Timberlake voices the character "Branch" in the film. The song was written by SZA, Timberlake, [[Ludwig Göransson]], [[Max Martin]] and [[Sarah Aarons]], while production was handled by Timberlake and Göransson.{{cite web|url=https://listen.tidal.com/album/132123190/credits|title=The Other Side / SZA, Justin Timberlake – Tidal|website=[[Tidal (service)|Tidal]]|accessdate=February 26, 2020}} ==Background and promotion== In February 2017, it was confirmed that Timberlake would be voicing the character Branch once again for a continuation of the ''Trolls'' series.{{cite web|url=https://variety.com/2017/film/news/trolls-2-announced-april-2020-dreamworks-animation-1201998983/|title=Universal DreamWorks Animation Announces ‘Trolls 2’; Sets for April 10, 2020|last=Kroll|first=Justin|website=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|date=February 28, 2017|accessdate=February 26, 2020}} On August 19, 2019, SZA stated in an interview with [[Kerwin Frost]] that she had recently hit the studio with Timberlake.{{cite web|url=http://hiii-power.com/2019/08/20/sza-interview-kerwin-frost/|title=New Interview : Sza Talks About Being in Album Mode , Her Music Influences and More|last=Chilkoti|first=Shailesh|website=[[HiiiPoWeR]]|date=August 20, 2019|accessdate=February 26, 2020}} Timberlake confirmed the collaboration in October 2019, although not yet disclosing any details on what project it was intended for.{{cite web|url=https://www.iheart.com/content/2019-10-15-justin-timberlake-confirms-collabs-with-lizzo-sza-meek-mill/|title=Justin Timberlake Confirms Collabs With Lizzo, SZA & Meek Mill|last=Brooks|first=Hayden|website=[[IHeartRadio]]|date=October 15, 2019|accessdate=February 26, 2020}} On January 20, 2020, SZA took to her social media to post pictures of her in different costumes and settings, which would later turn out to be part of the video shoot.{{cite web|url=https://www.hotnewhiphop.com/sza-and-justin-timberlakes-instagram-banter-allude-to-new-music-coming-soon-news.101420.html|title=SZA & Justin Timberlake's Instagram Banter Allude To New Music Coming Soon|last=Post|first=Chantilly|website=[[HotNewHipHop]]|date=January 20, 2020|accessdate=February 26, 2020}} About the collaboration with Timberlake, the singer explained that she was "thrilled to be invited to participate in this project with Justin".{{cite web|url=https://pitchfork.com/news/sza-and-justin-timberlake-share-new-song-the-other-side-listen/|title=SZA and Justin Timberlake Share New Song "The Other Side": Listen|last=Minsker|first=Evan|website=[[Pitchfork (website)|Pitchfork]]|date=February 26, 2020|accessdate=February 26, 2020}} On February 21, 2020, Timberlake posted a short video of himself talking about the song and providing the release date on Instagram. ==Composition== Amanda Gordon of ''[[Vulture (magazine)|Vulture]]'' described the song as "a deeply infectious, groovy song peppered with the kinds of handclaps and funky keyboard riffs designed to make you move".{{cite web|url=https://www.vulture.com/2020/02/sza-justin-timberlake-trolls-world-tour-the-other-side-video.html|title=SZA and Justin Timberlake Team Up for a Delightfully Groovy ''Trolls World Tour'' Song|last=Gordon|first=Amanda|website=[[Vulture (magazine)|Vulture]]|date=February 26, 2020|accessdate=February 26, 2020}} Furthermore, Jack Giroux of [[Grit (newspaper)|''Grit'']], described the song as "a joyful slice of poppy funkiness".{{Cite web|url=https://gritdaily.com/justin-timberlake/|title=Justin Timberlake and SZA Release ‘The Other Side’ Music Video|last=Giroux|first=Jack|date=February 28, 2020|website=[[Grit (magazine)|Grit]]|url-status=live|access-date=February 29, 2020}} ==Music video== The music video was released on February 26, 2020 and shows the artists dancing and grooving around in different settings. Critics drew comparisons to "[[Hype Williams]]' 1990s fish-eye-lensed clips for Missy Elliott, Diddy, Mase and others".{{cite web|url=https://variety.com/2020/music/news/sza-justin-timberlake-other-side-song-trolls-world-tour-1203516279/|title=SZA and Justin Timberlake Drop First Song From ''Trolls World Tour''|last=Aswad|first=Jem|website=Variety|date=February 26, 2020|accessdate=February 26, 2020}}{{cite web|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-news/justin-timberlake-sza-the-other-side-music-video-958256/|title=Justin Timberlake, SZA Get Funky on "The Other Side"|last=Shaffer|first=Claire|website=[[Rolling Stone]]|date=February 26, 2020|accessdate=February 26, 2020}} ==Charts== {| class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center" |- ! scope="col"| Chart (2020) ! scope="col"| Peak
